keyATM Covariates

Source: vignettes/pkgdown_files/keyATM_cov.Rmd
keyATM_cov.Rmd

Preparing documents and covariates

Please read Preparation for the reading of documents and creating a list of keywords. We use bills data we prapared (documents and keywords).

keyATM takes matrix type covariates data. If you have \(D\) documents and \(C\) covariates, the matrix should be \(D \times C\). In this example, we have a dummy variable that indicates …

library(keyATM)
data(keyATM_data_bills)
bills_cov <- keyATM_data_bills$cov
dim(bills_cov)  # We have 140 documents and a single covariate
## [1] 140   1

Fitting the model

out <- keyATM(    
              docs              = keyATM_docs,    # text input
              no_keyword_topics = 3,              # number of topics without keywords
              keywords          = bills_keywords, # keywords
              model             = "covariates",   # select the model
              model_settings    = list(covariates_data = bills_cov,
                                       covariates_formula = ~ RepParty),
              options           = list(seed = 100)
             )

The default number of iterations is 1500. Please check this page for available options.

Saving the model

Once you fit the model, you can save the model with save() for replication. This is the same as the Base model.

Checking top words

top_words(out)
##      1_Education        2_Law    3_Health        4_Drug    Other_1
## 1           loan    court [✓] program [✓]      drug [✓]    section
